page.title: 18A Lundy childhood remembered
page.content: At harvest time she loved to watch the farm workers toiling in the fields. Wooden hayricks were used to turn the hay.All the oats had to be labouriously cut by hand,and tied in bales with twisted strands of oats.At the end of each day the islanders would join together for a huge picnic in the fields. A lot of her time was spent on the beach,especially on 'Steamer' days. Mackerel fishing was a favourite occupation.A visit to the lighthouse keepers at North End was a real treat, always culminating in a feast of hard boiled Kittewake eggs with salt and home made bread. World events passed the island by without mournings or celebrations,but her mothers birthday was an excuse for great revelry. Family arrived in boatloads from the mainland,{continued
